entry.title: instant confirmation via payment protocol backwards compatible proto buffer extension
entry.summary: The context discusses the idea that writing code is a better approach to ensuring Bitcoin's robustness rather than blocking alternative approaches. The writer believes that if Bitcoin is truly robust, the market will naturally sort it out. However, if there are certain transactions that prove to be less robust, it could become a project for future generations of hackers to work on. The writer then encourages further discussion on the BIP itself, rather than engaging in philosophical debate about the future of Bitcoin.
